title: Online Learning Environment Design Workshop for Iranian University Students

context.prior_knowledge: Online learning experience and basic professional field knowledge
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning activities for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields exploring online learning environment design standards for Iranian university students

learning_goals: Learners propose an online education design tailored to the learning needs of Iranian university students using Problem-Based Learning methodology.

Learners can develop three or more interaction techniques using discovery learning strategies (e.g., question prompting, inquiry activity design) and demonstrate effectiveness with an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric through peer assessment and expert review.

Learners can develop three or more evaluation items per core criterion (goal-oriented learning, effective pedagogy, socioemotional engagement, learner autonomy) and create a 5-level (1â€“5) rubric for each, achieving over 80% suitability in peer review.

Graduate students can design a blended online learning model reflecting cultural backgrounds from three or more regions (e.g., East Asia, Europe, Middle East), achieving over 80% learner engagement and submitting a design plan meeting four or more of five cultural suitability checklist items within four weeks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
